summary: In this context, chlorobenzene (CB) is identified as a specific type of organic chemical, particularly an aromatic volatile organic compound (VOC) emitted from various chemical industries. The discussion highlights the toxic effects of aromatic VOCs, including chlorobenzene, on human health and their role in contributing to air pollution and photochemical smog. This establishes a clear relationship between chlorobenzene and the broader category of organic chemicals, emphasizing its significance as a harmful environmental pollutant.
